pr_title: [DOC] remove replicated install content from using guide

timeline.message:
[DOC] remove replicated install content from using guide

Signed-off-by: prmellor <pmellor@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Please can I check my understanding.
When using the {BookURLDeploying} attribute or the other {Book} attributes, it is necessary to use link instead of xref and to specify the module name in the square brackets. The caret symbol opens the link in a new tab. Is that right?
Does Asciidoctor complain if this advice is not followed?
We should update the documentation contributors guide with information on linking between the different guides that make up the Strimzi documentation.

replies.bodyText:
What do you think about specifying the name of the guide every time? So, that would be:
See Creating and managing connectors in the Deploying Strimzi guide.
replies.author: laidan6000

replies.bodyText:
Thanks Daniel. We don't need to open in a new tab, but it probably makes sense if we're navigating to anther guide. For example, in the deployment guide there might be a link to a schema table in the using guide. It's better to have the user guide open in another tab for reference.
Link is necessary, as we're navigating other paths. xref doesn't work.
Might be an idea to specify the guide name to make it clearer we're moving somewhere else.  👍
replies.author: PaulRMellor

I've added in Deploying Strimzi guide and Using Strimzi guide where appropriate.
In callouts where there might be several links, it didn't look right.
